subject_terms_3: Religious life and practices Textile art and design
physical_appearance: This is a textile depicting two rows of crocodiles and two rows of human figures. The base of the cloth is indigo blue and colourful thread was used to decorate.
sgcool_label_text: This cloth is a pua sungkit, a type of cloth produced using a rare supplementary warp wrapping technique in which additional coloured threads are carefully wrapped around the warp threads as the cloth is woven.  Most pua sungkit have a red ground colour but this one is dyed indigo blue, making it one of the rarest Iban cloths produced.
subject_terms_2: Ceremonial objects  Crocodiles in art  Human beings in art  Textile fabrics, Iban  Iban (Bornean people) Ancestors
